<lshobie@...> writes:

> Lighting may also have an effect on the colour of the steel.  I have a
> koto wak that looks like it has blackish steel under a compact
> flourescent bulb, yet looks very bluish under every other light.

This is an interesting observation.

The CFB should have a greater blue component in its spectrum than an
incandescent bulb. Incandescent has very little blue, so it is difficult
for things to look blue in this kind of light. 

I wonder what's going on.
 
- darcy
